subject: Management
title: Loss and Identity
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Loss and Identity.

hook.text: A senior engineer resisted the new process. It wasn't about the process. His expertise had become irrelevant.

buildup.text: Change often threatens people's identity: their expertise, their role, their sense of who they are.

discovery.text: William Bridges: every new beginning starts with an ending. People must grieve what they're losing.

twist.text: Resistance that looks irrational is often rational when you understand what the person is really losing.

climax.text: Acknowledge the loss. Name what's ending. Then help people see how their value carries forward.

punchline.text: Before you sell the future, honor what people are losing.

quiz.question: Why do people resist change even when it seems objectively better?
options: Change often threatens their identity, expertise, or sense of who they are
People are naturally irrational and cannot evaluate change objectively
Resistance only happens when the change is genuinely bad for them
